commits.message: Comment and add test printout of mask location

pull_request.title: Add image difference mask to tests
pull_request.body:
This adds in support in the testing suite for generating an image with a bright red overlay on the parts of the image that differ between expected and actual.  It also adds an output column to the html report that includes this difference highlighting image.
![image](https://github.com/openscad/openscad/assets/1266642/1e08731f-3dba-4ccc-a7bc-9246c34a0c46)

This makes it possible to run the test framework for a regular build.

issue.title: bytecode-based interpreter
issue.body:
https://github.com/openscad/openscad/pull/4654 contains several PRs that tries to speedup the speed of the interpreter. However, I think the fundamental performance problem with OpenSCAD interpreter is caused by the interpreter interpreting using the AST instead of some simpler structure such as bytecode. With a bytecode based interpreter, a lot of the overhead caused by identifier lookup and frame allocation can be avoided.

I just wrote a toy bytecode interpreter here: https://gist.github.com/pca006132/0786e2f91a24cbe70aeb77766810690d
It is just a simple stack machine implemented in typescript. The test.js is the compiled output that you can immediately run with nodejs. The speed on my machine is roughly 4 times faster (even when not using tailcall).

While one can argue that a complete implementation will be a lot more complicated and can slow things down, I still think that this is something that may bring further performance improvement to OpenSCAD. Translation from AST to bytecode should not be too slow as the translation time only depends on the size of the openscad file. This kind of bytecode format is also easier to perform code optimization and even JIT. Also, as we are not using a real stack, recursions that are not tail recursive can still run safely without having to worry about stack overflow, so the recursion limit can be raised.

comment.body: yes, python is also bytecode based

issue.title: bytecode-based interpreter
issue.body:
https://github.com/openscad/openscad/pull/4654 contains several PRs that tries to speedup the speed of the interpreter. However, I think the fundamental performance problem with OpenSCAD interpreter is caused by the interpreter interpreting using the AST instead of some simpler structure such as bytecode. With a bytecode based interpreter, a lot of the overhead caused by identifier lookup and frame allocation can be avoided.

I just wrote a toy bytecode interpreter here: https://gist.github.com/pca006132/0786e2f91a24cbe70aeb77766810690d
It is just a simple stack machine implemented in typescript. The test.js is the compiled output that you can immediately run with nodejs. The speed on my machine is roughly 4 times faster (even when not using tailcall).

While one can argue that a complete implementation will be a lot more complicated and can slow things down, I still think that this is something that may bring further performance improvement to OpenSCAD. Translation from AST to bytecode should not be too slow as the translation time only depends on the size of the openscad file. This kind of bytecode format is also easier to perform code optimization and even JIT. Also, as we are not using a real stack, recursions that are not tail recursive can still run safely without having to worry about stack overflow, so the recursion limit can be raised.

comment.body: You write a code, its converted to tokens, these tokens are executed in a huge statemachine with "DISPATCH" instruction in the end of each state which resolves to "goto"... thats Python ...

issue.title: The editor should allow to load and edit any text file not only scad files.
issue.body:
While openscad did not allow scripting actions,
it is useful to run scripts in other langauages
and there for sometimes minor changes to the scripts or data files is necessary.

Would be nice to stay in the same editor.

solution:
remove the fixed file ending and allow to load any kind of text file.

comment.body:
Yah, the point is there is no such pulldown that offers to open anything else than *scad.
(as shown in my screenshot)
When i create a new file i can save it under any name with any ending and can edit it but i can not load it again.

When writing a program it is an attribute to allow the user to change endings or go to *.* and eventually that was not set correct in this version of openscad so it is limited to openscad files only.

issue.title: Regular build causes lots of test failures
issue.body:
The regular, non-experimental, build of OpenSCAD has a large number of test failures:

```
cmake ..
make
ctest
```

-> `13% tests passed, 1328 tests failed out of 1527`

issue.title: The editor should allow to load and edit any text file not only scad files.
issue.body:
While openscad did not allow scripting actions,
it is useful to run scripts in other langauages
and there for sometimes minor changes to the scripts or data files is necessary.

Would be nice to stay in the same editor.

solution:
remove the fixed file ending and allow to load any kind of text file.

comment.body: Yes, sorry, I was not saying that OpenSCAD did what you want on Windows.  It is the same on Windows; it only offers *.scad and *.csg.  I was trying to point out how it *should* work.

```
                 from /home/david/gits/openscad/submodules/manifold/src/utilities/include/sparse.h:19,

In function ‘T* thrust::system::detail::sequential::trivial_copy_n(const T*, std::ptrdiff_t, T*) [with T = manifold::Box]’,

    inlined from ‘OutputIterator thrust::system::detail::sequential::copy(execution_policy<Derived>&, InputIterator, InputIterator, OutputIterator) [with DerivedPolicy = thrust::system::cpp::detail::par_t; InputIterator = manifold::Box*; OutputIterator = manifold::Box*]’ at /home/david/gits/openscad/submodules/manifold/src/third_party/thrust/thrust/system/detail/sequential/copy.inl:121:63,
    inlined from ‘OutputIterator thrust::copy(const detail::execution_policy_base<DerivedPolicy>&, InputIterator, InputIterator, OutputIterator) [with System = system::cpp::detail::par_t; InputIterator = manifold::Box*; OutputIterator = manifold::Box*]’ at /home/david/gits/openscad/submodules/manifold/src/third_party/thrust/thrust/detail/copy.inl:36:14,
    inlined from ‘ForwardIterator thrust::system::detail::generic::detail::uninitialized_copy(thrust::execution_policy<Derived>&, InputIterator, InputIterator, ForwardIterator, thrust::detail::true_type) [with ExecutionPolicy = thrust::system::cpp::detail::par_t; InputIterator = manifold::Box*; ForwardIterator = manifold::Box*]’ at /home/david/gits/openscad/submodules/manifold/src/third_party/thrust/thrust/system/detail/generic/uninitialized_copy.inl:100:22,
    inlined from ‘ForwardIterator thrust::system::detail::generic::uninitialized_copy(thrust::execution_policy<Derived>&, InputIterator, InputIterator, ForwardIterator) [with ExecutionPolicy = thrust::system::cpp::detail::par_t; InputIterator = manifold::Box*; ForwardIterator = manifold::Box*]’ at /home/david/gits/openscad/submodules/manifold/src/third_party/thrust/thrust/system/detail/generic/uninitialized_copy.inl:168:69,
    inlined from ‘ForwardIterator thrust::uninitialized_copy(const detail::execution_policy_base<DerivedPolicy>&, InputIterator, InputIterator, ForwardIterator) [with DerivedPolicy = system::cpp::detail::par_t; InputIterator = manifold::Box*; ForwardIterator = manifold::Box*]’ at /home/david/gits/openscad/submodules/manifold/src/third_party/thrust/thrust/detail/uninitialized_copy.inl:39:28,

make[1]: *** [CMakeFiles/Makefile2:556: submodules/manifold/src/collider/CMakeFiles/collider.dir/all] Error 2
make: *** [Makefile:166: all] Error 2
```
I have double-checked `MANIFOLD_USE_CUDA` is disabled in cmake, and no CUDA compiler is set.
All the dependencies seem installed:
```
(py39) [david@Hopper openscad]$ bash scripts/check-dependencies.sh 
depname           minimum           found             OKness            
qt                5.4               5.15.10           OK                
qscintilla2       2.9               2.13.4            OK                
cgal              5.4               5.5.3             OK                
gmp               5.0               6.2.1             OK                
mpfr              3.0               4.1.1             OK                
boost             1.56              1.78              OK                
opencsg           1.4.2             1.5.              OK                
glew              1.5.4             1.7.0             OK                
eigen             3.0               3.4.0             OK

freetype2         2.4               2.13.0            OK

bison             2.4               3.8.2             OK                
flex              2.5.35            2.6.4             OK                
make              3                 4.4.1             OK                
double-conversion 2.0.1             2.0.1             OK  
```

The changes I made on cmake:

`-DCMAKE_INSTALL_PREFIX=/home/david/.local  -DEXPERIMENTAL=true`

I am not sure what other information you need, but here is my [`CMakeCache.txt`](https://gist.github.com/Dapid/9ddae90126d50fe151e6665a9a0fcbf7).

issue.title: Compiling issues: Manifold and CUDA

comment.body:
What's the actual error message? The log is truncated.

OpenSCAD master branch may currently still point to a Manifold version which fails to compile with gcc-13. This is fixed upstream, update in OpenSCAD is pending in #4728.

issue.title: Compiling issues: Manifold and CUDA

comment.body: For the manifold-stlexport_stl-export it is expected due to changes in the triangulation. I have no idea about those png failures, will investigate them later.

issue.title: The editor should allow to load and edit any text file not only scad files.
issue.body:
While openscad did not allow scripting actions,
it is useful to run scripts in other langauages
and there for sometimes minor changes to the scripts or data files is necessary.

Would be nice to stay in the same editor.

solution:
remove the fixed file ending and allow to load any kind of text file.

comment.body:
![image](https://github.com/openscad/openscad/assets/47297504/07685b60-ce87-46c1-ad6d-58870eaa584f)

In Linux too, but the selector is fixed to openscad files, i can't click it and choose/edit others.

OpenSCAD  version 2023.10.12
Manjaro Linux

commits.message:
Remove unnecessary CGAL_OGL_Polyhedron and VBOPolyhedron

Separate out CVAL_OGL_VBOPolyhedron implementation into separate compilation unit

Remove excessive debug output
Add note about LLVM bug on macOS (#4783)

Document asciistl and binstl in the man page.

Text copied from `openscad --help` which already documents them.

Merge pull request #4792 from ChickenProp/chickenprop/update-manpage

Document asciistl and binstl in the man page.
Enable tracing of remaining glBindBuffer/glBufferData calls (#4793)
Green refactoring
Remove unused create() functions
Use unique_ptr where shared_ptr is unnecessary
Separate VBO-specific code into more specific functions
some docs
Move buffer allocation out of VertexArray, to keep allocation and deletion in the same components
Separate VertexState into separate compilation unit
Minor: remove unused functions, reorder instance variables
VertexStateManager doesn't really need to retain the renderer
Remove duplicate buffer initialization code; use VertexStateManager instead
Made VertexStateManager redundant
Minor: Simplify uniqueMultiply()
Support tracing GL_UNSIGNED_BYTE
Minor: Setter naming
Move createPolyhedrons() call to constructor to avoid repeating the same work in case of multiple Nef polyhedrons in lazy-unions mode
Remove excessive debug output
Add note about LLVM bug on macOS (#4783)

Document asciistl and binstl in the man page.

Text copied from `openscad --help` which already documents them.
